Award.AwardTitle: Geometric Inequalities and Fully Nonlinear Elliptic Equations
Award.AbstractNarration:
The Principal Investigator (PI) will study various geometric inequalities and their corresponding nonlinear partial differential equations in the context of conformal geometry and the geometry of submanifolds. One theme plans to investigate the effect of the higher order curvatures on the validity of the isoperimetric inequality. In particular, she intends to quantitatively analyze the interaction between the Q-curvature and the isoperimetric constant. The PI also proposes to study curvature inequalities of different orders for embedded submanifolds. These inequalities, originally considered in the context of convex geometry, have recently known to be valid on a very large class of non-convex domains. The PI's investigation strives to look for the full generality of such inequalities. In the meanwhile, she also aims to develop new skills to understand the corresponding fully nonlinear elliptic partial differential equations that arise naturally in the problem.

In the proposed study, the PI's research interest lies at the intersection of conformal geometry, the geometry of submanifolds and partial differential equations (PDEs). The study of geometric inequalities and geometric PDEs focuses on conformal invariants, which form an important machinery from physicists' point of view and have found applications to fundamental principles in mathematical physics. The research project to generalize classical results of convex geometry will improve our understanding on the rigidity of the established theory and will shed light on a greatly larger scope of its application.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The PI has completed research for her project "Geometric Inequalities and
Fully Nonlinear Elliptic Equations" supported by the NSF Grant DMS-1547878. During her funding period 2012-2015, as an geometric analysist, the PI was interested in understanding geometric PDEs and geometric inequalities related to conformal invariants. In the reporting funded period, the PI was specifically focused on the following research activities:

        1. collaboration with Paul Yang on studying the conformal Heisenberg manifolds and isoperimetric inequalities;

        2. collaboration with Paul Yang on quasiconformal mappings and geometric inequalities it deduces;

        3. collaboration with Zhiqin Lu on integrals of the Q-curvature and its behavior relating to the end of locally conformally flat manifolds;

        4. collaboration with Yannick Sire on the fractional Poincare inequality;

        5. collaboration with Alice Chang on studying the fully nonlinear equation of nonlocal type;

        6. collaboration with Alice Chang on the Alexandrov-Fenchel type of inequalities and examples on certain class of non-covex domains;

        7. collaboration with Po-Lam Yung on the Bourgain-Brezis inequality for Heisenberg groups;

        8. study of the deficit problem of isoperimetric inequaities by the method of optimal transport maps;

        9. study of the isoperimetric inequality and its relationship to how the space is curved.


In the reporting funded period, the PI has obtained satisfactory results in her collaborative research with Paul Yang on studying isoperimetric inequalities on Heisenberg manifolds; with Alice Chang on the Alexandrov-Fenchel type of inequalities; with Zhiqin Lu on integral of the Q-curvature on locally conformally flat manifolds; with Yannick Sire on fractional Poincare inequality; with Po-Lam Yung on the subelliptic Bourgain-Brezis inequality. She has also done an independent work on the isoperimetric inequality and Q-curvature, and an independent work on the quasiconformal mapping and conformally flat manifolds. She wrote three joint papers with Alice Chang, and one joint paper with each of the above mentioned collaborators. Last but not least, she's made nice progresses on problems regarding the fully nonlinear equations of nonlocal type with Alice Chang.


Results funded by this NSF grant are important contributions to the field of conformal geometry, geometric inequalities and geometric PDEs. The PI's research during the funded period 2012-2015 forms a solid basis and will
benefit substantially her future research career. 


The PI accomplished the goal of her research and assisted in creating public outreach materials for the field. She co-organized with Jeffery Case and Alice Chang a special session in the AMS Northeastern sectional meeting Nov 14-15, 2015 at New Brunswick, NJ. She assists graduate students and young people to talk at sectional meeting in order to be visible to experts in the field. During the funded three years, she was invited for more than 30 times at conferences and seminars, to talk about her research work. She developed a graduate course for students to get access to her field of interest.
